title: Alleged Forestry Corruption in Dhanusha involving Hem Bahadur Malla (c. 1986)
description:
This case concerns allegations of corruption against former minister Hem Bahadur Malla related to forestry activities in Dhanusha district, purported to have occurred around 2043 BS (c. 1986-1987 AD). The core allegation, originating from a single internal document, claims a financial loss of NPR 3,24,00,000.

However, extensive research of public records, news archives, and legal databases has yielded no corroborating evidence to support these specific claims. There is no public information about a corruption case from that period involving Hem Bahadur Malla, his alleged alias 'Shere of Dhanusha', or an associate named Sharada Malla.

Publicly available information, in contrast, portrays Hem Bahadur Malla as a respected public administrator, primarily known as the founder and leader of the Salt Trading Corporation. In recognition of his contributions, the 'Hem Bahadur Malla Samman' was established in 2059 BS (2002 AD) by the Nepal Public Administration Association and Salt Trading Corporation to honor excellence in public service. He passed away in 2057 BS (2000 AD).

It is worth noting that the Sagarnath Forest area has been the subject of other, more recent and unrelated corruption investigations, such as those involving illegal land encroachment by local officials in the 2020s.
unverified_info:
The following details are derived exclusively from an initial, uncorroborated source document and could not be independently verified through public records. They should be treated as unconfirmed allegations.

  • Alleged Case Name: Corruption of 'Shere' of Dhanusha (धनुषाका 'शेरे' को भ्रष्टाचार)
  • Alleged Subject: Forestry (वन)
  • Year of Allegation: 2043 BS (c. 1986-1987 AD)
  • Alleged Financial Loss: NPR 32,400,000 (३ करोड २४ लाख)
  • Primary Accused: Hem Bahadur Malla (हेमबहादुर मल्ल)
  • Alleged Alias: 'Shere' (शेरे)
  • Associated Individual: Sharada Malla (शारदा मल्ल)
